title: Plan OO Containerized deployment on GKE
content:
By default, an OO Containerized installation supports up to 5 tenants. The following sizing requirements are based on running 5 tenants.

Nodes configuration GKE GCP Cloud SQL 
Instance Type Configuration Storage Quantity Configuration Additional storage Instance Type Core Count vCPU Memory Storage Engine max_connections
n2-standard-8 8 vCPU 32 GB RAM 100 GB 2 OO shares the same GKE server with the suite. 500 GB n2-highmem-2 1 2 16 GB 750 GB ~ 5 TB PG 13.x, 14.x, 15.x, 16.x 1400

OO Containerized also supports up to 20 tenants. The following sizing requirements are based on running 20 tenants.

Nodes configuration GKE GCP Cloud SQL 
Instance Type Configuration Storage Quantity Configuration Additional storage Instance Type Core Count vCPU Memory Storage Engine max_connections
n2-standard-8 8 vCPU 32 GB RAM 100 GB 8 OO shares the same GKE server with the suite. 500 GB n2-highmem-2 4 8 64 GB 750 GB ~ 5 TB PG 13.x, 14.x, 15.x, 16.x 5710
 
 
  • It's recommended to use a dedicated Cloud SQL instance for OO Containerized in Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • If you choose to connect OO Containerized to the same Cloud SQL instance as the rest of the suite components, you need to resize the instance to a machine type that can support the additional workload from both the suite and OO Containerized.
  • OO Containerized shares the same Persistent Disk (PD-SSD or PD-HDD) with the suite.
 
 

You can modify the max_connections parameter. For details, see the Google Cloud SQL documentation.

To set the max_connections parameter of the Cloud SQL instance used by OO Containerized, follow these steps:

  1. Modify the Cloud SQL instance settings:
    1. Go to Google Cloud Console, then Cloud SQL.
    2. Select the Cloud SQL instance.
    3. Click Edit, then scroll to Flags.
    4. Add max_connections and set it to the required value.
  2. Restart the instance.
    If the Cloud SQL instance was created before this parameter change, you need to restart it for the new settings to take effect.
